Description: Rim and ornamental handle sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; cream slip; paint fired mostly red; interior: wide black zone with two added red bands; exterior: on top of rim, maeander frieze, on edge, vertical bars; ornamental ring handle decorated at top, which is a hollow tube, with vertical grooves, glazed on outside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For handle parallels, see Cook and Dupont, 1998, p. 54, fig. 8.19. See also Walter-Karydi, ‘Samos - VI/1 Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts v. Chr.’, Bonn (1973), pl. 114, fig. 938.
The curvature of the inside suggests a dinos rather than a krater.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.495)
